event: Joe Biden was elected to the New Castle County Council in 1970 and to the United States Senate in 1973.
Name: Joe Biden

event: In April 2023, Joe Biden announced Joe Biden's candidacy for the the Democratic Party nomination in the 2024 presidential election.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden was born on November 20, 1942, at St. Mary's Hospital in Scranton, Pennsylvania, to Catherine Eugenia "Jean" Biden (née Finnegan) and Joseph Robinette Biden Sr.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joseph Robinette Biden Sr had been wealthy and a Catholic family of largely Irish descent purchased a home in the affluent Long Island suburb of Garden City in the fall of 1946, but Joseph Robinette Biden Sr suffered business setbacks around the time Joe Biden was seven years old, and for several years a Catholic family of largely Irish descent lived with Joe Biden's maternal grandparents in Scranton, Pennsylvania.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Beginning in 1953 when Joe Biden was ten, a Catholic family of largely Irish descent lived in an apartment in Claymont, Delaware, before moving to a house in nearby Mayfield.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden was admitted to the Delaware bar in 1969.In 1968
category1: Marriages, law school, and early career (1966–1973)
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden disliked incumbent Democratic Delaware governor Charles L. Terry's's conservative racial politics and supported a more liberal Republican, Russell W. Peterson, who defeated incumbent Democratic Delaware governor Charles L. Terry's in 1968.
category1: Marriages, law school, and early career (1966–1973)
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden won the general election by defeating Republican Lawrence T. Messick, and took office on January 5, 1971.
category1: Marriages, law school, and early career (1966–1973)
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden served until January 1, 1973, and was succeeded by Democrat Francis R. Swift.
category1: Marriages, law school, and early career (1966–1973)
Name: Joe Biden

event: In 1968, based on a physical examination, Joe Biden was given a conditional medical deferment; in 2008, a spokesperson for Joe Biden said Joe Biden's having had "asthma as a teenager" was the reason for a conditional medical deferment.
category1: Marriages, law school, and early career (1966–1973)
Name: Joe Biden

event: President Clinton vetoed bankruptcy legislation sought by credit card issuers in 2000, but bankruptcy legislation sought by credit card issuers passed in 2005 as the Bankruptcy Abuse Prevention and Consumer Protection Act, with Joe Biden being one of only 18 Democrats to vote for the Bankruptcy Abuse Prevention and Consumer Protection Act, while leading Democrats and consumer rights organizations opposed the Bankruptcy Abuse Prevention and Consumer Protection Act.
Name: Joe Biden

event: In February 1988, after several episodes of increasingly severe neck pain, Joe Biden was taken by ambulance to Walter Reed Army Medical Center for surgery to correct a leaking intracranial berry aneurysm.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden chaired the Senate Committee on the Judiciary from 1987 to 1995 and was a ranking minority member from 1981 to 1987 and again from 1995 to 1997.As chair, Joe Biden presided over two highly contentious U.S. Supreme Court confirmation hearings.
Name: Joe Biden

event: When Robert Bork was nominated in 1988, Joe Biden reversed Joe Biden's approval‍—‌ given in an interview the previous year‍—‌ of a hypothetical Robert Bork nomination.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden became the Senate Foreign Relations Committee's ranking minority member in 1997 and chaired the Senate Foreign Relations Committee from June 2001 to 2003 and 2007 to 2009.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden raised more in the first quarter of 1987 than any other candidate.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden was officially nominated for vice president on August 27 by voice vote at the 2008 Democratic National Convention in Denver.[0
Name: Joe Biden

event: Having won both races, Joe Biden made a point of waiting to resign from the Senate until Joe Biden was sworn in for Joe Biden's seventh term on January 6, 2009.
Name: Joe Biden

event: On January 20, 2009, Joe Biden was sworn in as the 47th vice president of the United States.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden lost an internal debate to Secretary of State Hillary Clinton about sending 21,000 new troops to Afghanistan, but Joe Biden's skepticism was valued, and in 2009, Joe Biden's views gained more influence as Obama reconsidered Obama's Afghanistan strategy.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden was inaugurated to a second term on January 20, 2013, at a small ceremony at Number One Observatory Circle, Joe Biden's official residence, with Justice Sonia Sotomayor presiding (a public ceremony took place on January 21).Biden played little part in discussions that led to the October 2013 passage of the Continuing Appropriations Act, 2014, which resolved the federal government shutdown of 2013 and the debt-ceiling crisis of 2013.
Name: Joe Biden

event: During a second term, Joe Biden was often said to be preparing for a bid for the 2016 Democratic presidential nomination.
Name: Joe Biden

event: With Joe Biden's family, many friends, and donors encouraging Joe Biden in mid-2015 to enter the 2016 Democratic presidential nomination, and with Hillary Clinton's favorability ratings in decline at that time, Joe Biden was reported to again be seriously considering a bid for the 2016 Democratic presidential nomination and a "Draft Joe Biden 2016" PAC was established.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden finally launched Joe Biden's campaign on April 25, 2019, saying Joe Biden was prompted to run because Joe Biden was worried by the Trump administration and felt a "sense of duty".
Name: Joe Biden

event: On August 18, 2020, Joe Biden was officially nominated at the 2020 Democratic National Convention as the Democratic Party nominee for president in the 2020 election.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden was elected the 46th president of the United States in November 2020.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden was inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States on January 20, 2021.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden is also the first man since George H. W. Bush to have been both vice president and president, and the second non-incumbent vice president (after Richard Nixon in 1968) to be elected president.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden signed a deal to raise the debt limit, the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023 on June 3, averting a default.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden blamed Russian president Vladimir Putin for the emerging energy and food crises, saying, "Russian president Vladimir Putin's has raised the price of food because Ukraine and Russia are two of the world's's major breadbaskets for wheat and corn, the basic product for so many foods around the world's."On February 20, 2023
Name: Joe Biden

event: In a September 2022 interview with 60 Minutes, Joe Biden said that U.S. forces would defend Taiwan in the event of "an unprecedented attack" by the Chinese, which is in contrast to the long-standing U.S. policy of "strategic ambiguity" toward China's and Taiwan.
Name: Joe Biden

event: In May 2021, during a flareup in the Israeli–Palestinian conflict, Joe Biden said, "Joe Biden's party still supports Israel".
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden has supported same-sex marriage since 2012.As a senator
Name: Joe Biden

event: In recent years, especially after the 2015 death of Joe Biden's elder son Beau, Joe Biden has been noted for Joe Biden's empathetic nature and ability to communicate about grief.
Name: Joe Biden

event: Joe Biden has a reputation for being prone to gaffes and in 2018 called Joe Biden "a gaffe machine".
Name: Joe Biden
